intro: Microtoena muliensis, commonly known as the Muliensis microtoena, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 10,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
